ITEM 2. Properties
Our headquarters are located in a leased facility located at 400 Rella Boulevard, Montebello, New York. We also own a corporate office location in Yonkers, New York and lease corporate back-office space in Lake Success and Jericho on Long Island, New York. At December 31, 2018, we conducted our business through 106 full-service retail and commercial financial centers which serve the New York Metro Market and the New York Suburban Market. Of these financial centers, 24 are located in Nassau County, New York, 22 in Suffolk County, New York, 14 in Queens County, New York, 12 in Westchester County, New York, 11 in Kings County, New York, eight in in Rockland County, New York, six in Orange County, New York, three in New York City, New York and two in Bronx County, New York. We also operate one office in each of Sullivan, Ulster, and Putnam Counties in New York and one office in Bergen County, New Jersey. Additionally, 57 of our financial centers are owned and 49 are leased.
In addition to our financial center network and corporate offices, we lease 19 additional properties which are used for general corporate purposes. See Note 6. “Premises and Equipment, Net” in the notes to consolidated financial statements for further detail on our premises and equipment.

Here's a multi-form question based on the provided documentation:

Question: Which of the following statements accurately describes Sterling National Bank's property holdings and office locations as of December 31, 2018?

A) The bank owns its headquarters in Montebello, New York and leases a corporate office in Yonkers, New York.

B) Sterling National Bank operates 106 full-service retail and commercial financial centers, with the majority located in Nassau and Suffolk counties.

C) The bank leases 57 of its financial centers and owns 49, while also leasing 19 additional properties for general corporate purposes.

D) Sterling National Bank has financial centers in 12 different counties across New York State and New Jersey, with the highest concentration in Queens County.

Correct Answer: C

Explanation: 
Option A is incorrect because the headquarters in Montebello, New York is leased, not owned, while the corporate office in Yonkers is owned, not leased.

Option B is partially correct about the total number of financial centers but incorrect about the majority location. While there are indeed 106 full-service retail and commercial financial centers, Nassau and Suffolk counties combined only account for 46 of these (24 and 22 respectively), which is not a majority.

Option C is correct. The document explicitly states that "57 of our financial centers are owned and 49 are leased" and that they "lease 19 additional properties which are used for general corporate purposes."

Option D is incorrect because while the bank does have financial centers in multiple counties, the highest concentration is not in Queens County. Queens has 14 centers, while Nassau has 24 and Suffolk has 22, both higher than Queens.

ITEM 2. PROPERTIES.
WHAT DO WE OWN?
Our physical properties consist primarily of plant and equipment used to provide communications services. Our properties also include administrative office buildings. We own and lease properties to support our offices, facilities and equipment.
Telecommunications plant and equipment consists of: central office equipment, including switching and transmission equipment; connecting lines (cables, wires, poles, conduits, etc.); land and buildings; and miscellaneous properties (work equipment, furniture, plant under construction, etc.). The majority of the connecting lines are on or under public roads, highways and streets and international and territorial waters. The remainder are on or under private property. We also operate a number of sales offices, customer care centers, and other facilities, such as research and development laboratories.
We continue to manage the deployment and utilization of our assets in order to meet our global growth objectives while at the same time ensuring that these assets are generating value for the shareholder. We will continue to manage our asset base consistent with marketplace forces, productivity growth and technological change.
ITEM 3.

Question: A telecommunications company is conducting an asset review to optimize its operations. Which of the following strategies would be LEAST aligned with the company's approach to asset management as described in the documentation?

A) Regularly assessing the productivity of central office equipment and replacing outdated switching systems
B) Maintaining all current administrative office buildings regardless of utilization or efficiency
C) Evaluating the potential for shared infrastructure agreements for connecting lines on public roads
D) Investing in research and development laboratories to drive technological innovation

Option C reflects efficient asset utilization and potential cost-saving measures.
Option D supports the company's commitment to technological change and growth.

However, option B suggests maintaining all administrative buildings regardless of their efficiency or utilization, which goes against the stated goal of ensuring assets generate value and adapting to marketplace forces. This approach would be the least aligned with the company's asset management strategy as described.

ITEM 2. DESCRIPTION OF PROPERTY
Our corporate headquarters is located in Andover, Massachusetts, and consists of approximately 7,500 square feet. Our lease expires on April 30, 2004. We also have leased additional administrative offices in Lake Success, New York, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, and Addison, Texas, consisting of approximately 83,131 square feet in total. We believe that our headquarters office space is sufficient for our immediate needs and that we will be able to obtain additional space as needed in the future.
We lease all of our branch office locations from unaffiliated landlords. Most of our branch office leases are for a specified term, although several of them are month-to-month leases. Currently, we have 93 locations throughout the United States, for which square footage and rental terms are varied. We believe that we will be able to renew or find adequate replacement offices for leases that are scheduled to expire in the next twelve months at comparable costs.
In addition, we own or lease computer and communication equipment necessary to operate our business.
